org.kocakosm.pitaya.util

Class XArrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.util.XArrays

  • public final class XArrays
extends Object
    Various extra utilities for arrays.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK
    See Also:
    Arrays

      static <T> T[] sort(T[] a)
      Returns a sorted copy of the given array of objects into ascending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements (all elements in the array must implement the Comparable interface).
      static <T> T[] sort(T[] a, Comparator<? super T> c)
      Returns a sorted copy of the given array of objects into ascending order, according to the order induced by the given Comparator.

      • copyOf

        public static long[] copyOf(long[] a,
                            int off,
                            int len)
        Copies the specified range of elements from the given array into a new array. The returned array will be padded with 0, if necessary, so that it has an exact length of len.
        Parameters:
        a - the source array.
        off - the starting position in the source array.
        len - the number of elements to copy (returned array's length).
        Returns:
        a new array containing the specified range of the source array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative.
        NegativeArraySizeException - if len is negative.

      • copyOf

        public static int[] copyOf(int[] a,
                           int off,
                           int len)

        Parameters:

        len - the number of elements to copy (returned array's length).
        Returns:

        Throws:

        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative.
        NegativeArraySizeException - if len is negative.

                             int off,
                             int len)
        Copies the specified range of elements from the given array into a new array. The returned array will be padded with null, if necessary, so that it has an exact length of len.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the array to copy.
        Parameters:
        a - the source array.
        off - the starting position in the source array.

        Returns:
        a new array containing the specified range of the source array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if off is negative.
        NegativeArraySizeException - if len is negative.

      • copyOf

        public static long[] copyOf(long... original)
        Returns a copy of the given array. The original array and the returned copy will have identical length and content.
        Parameters:
        original - the array to be copied.
        Returns:
        a copy of the original array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if original is null.

        public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] original)
        Returns a copy of the given array. The original array and the returned copy will have identical length and content.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the array to copy.
        Parameters:
        original - the array to be copied.
        Returns:
        a copy of the original array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if original is null.

      • rotate

        public static long[] rotate(long[] a,
                            int distance)
        Returns a new array containing the same elements as the given one, but rotated by the given distance. The element at index i in the returned array corresponds to the element in the original array at index (i - distance) mod a.length, for all values of i between 0 and a.length - 1, inclusive. Note that rotation by 0 or by a multiple of a.length is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to rotate.
        distance - the distance to rotate.
        Returns:
        the rotated array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.

      • rotate

        public static int[] rotate(int[] a,
                           int distance)

        Parameters:
        a - the array to rotate.
        distance - the distance to rotate.
        Returns:
        the rotated array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.

      • shuffle

        public static long[] shuffle(long... a)
        Returns a copy of the given array where its element have been randomly permuted. This method uses the optimized version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle algorithm (Fisher, Yates, Durstenfeld, Knuth) and thus runs in linear time.
        Parameters:
        a - the array whose content will be shuffled.
        Returns:
        the shuffled array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.

      • shuffle

        public static long[] shuffle(long[] a,
                             Random rnd)
        Returns a copy of the given array where its element have been randomly permuted using the specified source of randomness. All permutations occur with equal likelihood assuming that the source of randomness is fair. This method uses the optimized version of the Fisher-Yates shuffle algorithm (Fisher, Yates, Durstenfeld, Knuth) and thus runs in linear time.
        Parameters:
        a - the array whose content will be shuffled.
        rnd - the source of randomness to use.
        Returns:
        the shuffled array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one of the arguments is null.

      • shuffle

      • sort

        public static <T> T[] sort(T[] a)
        Returns a sorted copy of the given array of objects into ascending order, according to the natural ordering of its elements (all elements in the array must implement the Comparable interface).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the array to sort.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        a sorted copy of the given array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a is null.
        ClassCastException - if the array contains elements that are not mutually comparable (for example, Strings and Integers).
        IllegalArgumentException - if the natural ordering of the array elements is found to violate the Comparable contract.
        See Also:
        Arrays.sort(java.lang.Object[])

      • sort

        public static <T> T[] sort(T[] a,
                           Comparator<? super T> c)
        Returns a sorted copy of the given array of objects into ascending order, according to the order induced by the given Comparator.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the array to sort.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be sorted.
        c - the comparator to determine the order of the array.
        Returns:
        a sorted copy of the given array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if a or c is null.
        ClassCastException - if the array contains elements that are not mutually comparable (for example, Strings and Integers).
        See Also:
        Arrays.sort(java.lang.Object[], java.util.Comparator)

        public static long[] toPrimitive(Long... a)

        Returns:
        the corresponding long array.

        NullPointerException - if a contains a null value.

        Arrays.toString(int[])

      • toString

        public static String toString(short... a)
        Returns a String representation of the contents of the given array. Returns "null" if a is null.
        Parameters:
        a - the array whose String representation to return.
        Returns:
        a String representation of a.
        See Also:
        Arrays.toString(short[])

      • toString

        Parameters:
        a - the array whose String representation to return.
        Returns:
        a String representation of a.
        See Also:
        Arrays.toString(char[])

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object[] a)
        Returns a String representation of the contents of the given array. Accepts multidimensional arrays. Returns "null" if a is null.
        Parameters:
        a - the array whose String representation to return.
        Returns:
        a String representation of a.
        See Also:
        Arrays.deepToString(java.lang.Object[])
